title: Well Done Microsoft. Well Done.
text: Teams has always been a solid choice for a workplace collaboration application/platform. However, over the last year or so, the product and dev teams at MS have added more useful features and a truly great user experience. Seriously, Teams is now a masterclass in how to create a platform that seamlessly works between desktop and tablet/mobile. I’m an Apple fanboy at heart, but I had to give MS some credit with this one.

title: Mobile app potential
text:
Update: I currently am not able to do video chats via my iPhone. This previously was a feature. My iPhone is update. When will video chat be a restored feature for the app ? 
....

I’ve been worked on several projects over the years to help get team collaboration to be clear and effective. I think Microsoft teams has that potential compared to other programs I have used. Right now though on the mobile app iOS I am unable to add files, wiki pages, or websites under the tab feature. I hope this will change in the next update. I work mainly from my iOS

title: Please! Option to shut calls off!!!
text:
I work at a Dental School and we recently switched to a Teams phone system, which has been nice. And, the convenience of chatting amongst ourselves in Teams Chat is great. However, when you have the app on your phone, the business calls ring through on your cell phone. 
Can you please add an option to turn cell phone call access off on the Teams app, so as not to receive business calls on your personal cell? Thank you!!!

title: Unintuitive
text:
Try to avoid using teams. The notification system is terrible and often leads to a lot of missed messages. The way that messages reorganise when people add a reply makes the conversation history confusing. Limited number of conversations you can pin is annoying because if you have a big team you must use the terrible search functionality to find them. Search muddles up all your content (mostly a problem of the mac app).

If you are considering using teams for your company go with Slack or basically anything else.

Microsoft devs, this isn't directed at you at all as you can only do what your product owner allows you to.

title: The backround efects is not working properly
text: With the last update, the background you choose takes over the user; now you need to be extremely close to the camera to make it work; otherwise, you will be blurred or behind the image you selected as background. I am using an iPhone 12 Pro Max. Dear developer, can you comment on this issue? Maybe I am the only one having this problem; I uninstalled and reinstalled the app twice with the same result. Thank you.

title: Does everything you would expect and more
text:
This app does a great job of taking the teams functionality over to mobile devices.  Basically, all the functions you are used to from the web and desktop versions are Incorporated.

Even better than those, or can handle multiple teams accounts at once with easy click between.  This means that, for anyone using teams with multiple employers or organisations, this app is a must.

title: There is no goto message feature
text: The app is very good but it does not have “go to particular message”feature. For example if i have a very long chat and if I search something I can easily saw the message in the search result but I cannot go that message easily. So there should be feature of “go to particular message” Also the mobile app has reply to message feature but the desktop version does not have such feature at the moment. Please add reply to message feature in the desktop version.

title: Great app but..
text: I use everything Microsoft. It’s quick, easy, and everything’s connected.. up until today. I love using the To-Do app on my desktop at home and, at work, using my organization’s email on both the To Do app and on Teams is a breeze. There was envelope integration for To-Do in Teams. It eliminates one extra window from being open. However, I checked my To Do list right now in my organization’s Teams and my ToDo list is gone. Upsetting as we’re about to start a meeting about deadlines. Disappointed as I do not have my laptop on me. Hope this issue gets resolved. I loved the integration.

title: Teams mobile app rules!
text: I’m not sure whyI waited so long to download the Teams mobile app, but I’m sure glad I did. I like it more than I like the desktop app. You have the ability to take pictures with your phone which can then be sent to your teammates. I also find that I frequently receive messages on the mobile app before they come through on my computer. Love Teams, especially the mobile app!

title: Almost as if it has a mind of its own
text: As a student whose school relies on Teams to send out assignments and send back responses I’m upset to report that Teams almost has a mind of its own.  I have had a handful of times when Teams will tell me that it submitted my assignment to my teacher but I find out the next day that it never submitted anything, I’m only lucky that I do my assignments two days in advance or else I might have hundreds of late grades.  Sometimes Teams doesn’t even assign me my work till after the due date.  I just had to do an English assignment that was due yesterday but I received the assignment today.

title: Needs sone improvement
text:
So, overall I love Teams. It’s a great app, and I use it a lot now for school because of COVID-19. But, there are some changes that need to be made, and I have one specific in mind.
    I don’t know if it’s just me, but I mainly use teams on my iPad, and it’s really frustrating when I can’t upload into folders, so I have to do this whole transition process from my iPad to my Computer just to get it to upload. 
   Once again, I’m not sure if this is a personal problem, but I’m guessing not because my friends and classmates have the same issue with the mobile version. Please fix this!!!

title: Inappropriate and Unprofessional
text: As a teacher this app is very unprofessional . I don’t have my students use this app anymore, because it doesn’t allow use a lot of accessories. For example, it doesn’t protect the student’s privacy, when they are having their own personal conversations. Also, my students have had problems with turning in assignments. It takes them very long to send pictures of their work to me, because the application is so slow. I have also received complaints about the turning in of assignments. It often glitches, and my students have to redo the work they already did. If the algorithm can get fixed, the app might actually work fine, and not be a waste of time.

title: Error when answering calls from a queue
text: We have teams set up for an auto attendant and call queue. When we set an iPhone (7, 8 or XR) to receive, we cannot answer the incoming calls. Specifically, the phone rings, a notification comes up on screen along with the slide to answer. Sliding to answer, at first seems like it is going to work, but drops the call. Oddly enough, if the iPhone is in an unlocked state and this is attempted, it works perfectly. However, there is no slide bar, only an accept button in that scenario. I believe there is something broken with the slide bar in this app.

title: Won’t give out notifications after update
text:
Won’t vibrate when a notification comes in and won’t even make a noise either, this happens 
 When the phone is unlocked or locked.
I have missed tons of IMs Bc The notifications are not working.  When they used to before the update.  I just see tons of notifications on my locked screen when I take a look at my phone and yes I have everything turn on as it should
 I get all my notifications for outlook texts everything besides teams.  And looking at the other review I’m not the only one.  Please fix it’s been over 4 weeks to fix this bug and it’s one of the most important things you need on a app. To get notifications!!!!!

title: Missing File Notifications
text:
Trying to replace project related emails with this. I’ve really only one complaint about notifications. 

Maybe I haven’t found the right notification setting, but it would be nice to have the option to get a notification if a file is uploaded to a directory on one of my teams. The way it is, if someone uploads a file to one of the teams I’m on, they have to notify me or I periodically check and eventually notice it. 

I like the aesthetics of the app. If I can find out how to get file notifications similar to what Dropbox has for years, it would rate 4 or 5 stars.

title: Overall it works, could be better
text: I use this all the time for screen sharing. I use my phone significantly more than my laptop in meetings. It is frustrating that after this time Teams does not use my full screen even when “focusing on content”. The space by the island is wasted and significant space is wasted on the end of the screen as well. At the very least when I start zooming in these spaces should show the content. Please fix this.

title: Function request
text:
May I ask for a functional update? 
Can you have the Camera and Mic icons change a color when on or off? 
Have it be all green when on and all red when off so it stands out a little more and easier to see from far away if I’m on mute or not. On camera is more of a lesser thing but it would be a NOCE TO HAVE especially when in large groups when you are multitasking and want to double check that you’re on mute or not on camera.
Thanks

title: Garbage compared to Slack
text:
This all has a few good things going for it like integration with outlook and AD etc but overall it is nothing compared to usability and look and feel of slack. 

Especially when it comes to search capabilities, pretty much every single time i want to look up a previous message or previous file there is no way in heck i’d recover it, all sorts of weird messages about stuff being deleted or no longer available. 

I think what this tool is really good at is it lets employers keep a very close eye on their workers through strict idle times and status checks etc

title: The mobile app has problems
text: I enjoy teams, it works well most of the time but some times it will show that there is a meeting going on in a group but there is no way for you to join. Anytime I’m in a teams meeting without headphones my screen flashes to black and then back and sometimes adjusts the brightness of my screen on its own. It makes it very difficult to do anything else while in a meeting. It even disabled my ability to adjust my screen brightness, everytime it goes black and then kicks me out of the menu.

title: Fixed a bug on iPhone 12
text: My teams app hasn’t been working for the last week and I noticed a few others in these reviews had the same issue.  Finally, after uninstalling/re-installing, restarting my phone, etc...I went into the settings for the app and activated the “Clear data” option.  Close out teams and reopen, then enter your info back in and it should work again. Did for me. Hope this helps others!

title: Great App!!
text: Amazing app! Only thing I'd like to see is more administrative control - onky certain people can join teams and always have the admins have owner roles automatically. Also would like to have a "read" receipt for posts and conversations to see if everybody is getting the messages to make sure they are fully understanding the new app. Besides that our company is loving the implementation of the Teams App for our everyday work flow. Company Communication is getting much better with the Teams App!

title: One thing missing
text: This app is great almost does everything my laptop does! BUT a huge but it NEEDS to have email notifications when plugged into Apple car play, I have no idea when I get emails driving and that can be the difference in getting or loosing a million dollar deal and many other business oriented things..... enough said. Simple sound on the car speakers so I can pull over safely would be a huge help!!! Thanks hope to see this in the next update. If it’s there as an option and I’m not seeing PLEASE inform me.

title: I can’t hear the caller
text:
Ever since January 31,2019 in the afternoon, Neither I nor my technicians can hear the caller when they call using the mobile app. 

We use a queue- we have full cloud pbx with pstn calling. 

This is not teams with teams calling. There are no problems with meetings within teams. 

We tried taking the calls with wi-fi and then with just our phone plans. 

Some of us are with tmobile and others under att. 

Its 100% queue. An outsider calls our queue, call comes into teams and after the call connects, you can’t hear the other person. 

Sometimes they hear you sometimes they don’t. 

We tried placing the caller on hold and then resuming the call, but then the app isn’t consistent with accepting the hold. It just wont do anything. And then the “call failed” screen appears. 

We really need this fixed.

title: Makes life easier
text: I work from home and still love the ability to use the app instead of going into my office each time. With my company we use teams all day long between screen sharing and meeting, training, chats to ask questions. Without teams my work from home job wouldn't be possible. And the app just makes it even easier to stay connected. Amazing plate form. Way to go Microsoft!!!

title: Minimum audio volume with AirPods or EarPods is far too loud
text: The app works well overall but doesn’t allow the user to reduce volume below a certain threshold (or even mute audio). This has been a huge problem as I use earphones for all of my meetings but the minimum audio setting is far too loud. It is painful after a few minutes and generally bothersome. There are hundreds of threads online addressing this issue since mid 2021 one now and Microsoft has still not fixed this issue. Strange because it’s as close to a health issue as an app can get… writing this in hopes someone does something.

title: Unmute with emojis!
text:
It was an "ok" app until this recent update. When on iphone, the mute/unmute option (that every business user must always have their hands near) have been moved off of the main screen and now you must swipe up to get to them. Meanwhile, what's readily available during the call without swiping is emojis. What better way to add value to your BUSINESS app by removing critical BUSINESS features for adults and replacing them with childish features like emojis? 

I don't know, maybe this is how business runs in silicon valley. If so, maybe I'll go grab my diaper and a onesie and start applying for jobs... USING ONLY EMOJIS. You deserve zero stars for this move, clowns.

title: Is Good, but flawed
text:
Not sure why this has to replace Skype but this basically does the same and mostly well except:
No ability to set when you flip from available to away. It’s just 10 minutes, which is way to short. Skype allowed you to set it. 
Using a virtual desktop you can only share a screen, you can’t share a window. Not a problem in Skype. 
The iOS app works well, with the same drawbacks. It’s nicely integrated into the phone and easy to use for calling work colleagues. Call quality is good.

title: Teams is remarkable
text:
I recently started a new job at an amazing company.I was really worried about virtual on boarding and not getting to have a good relationship with my partners. In the two weeks I’ve been on boarding I’ve been doing video calls, using the chatting function, and using Teams to schedule meetings regularly with everybody on my team. This application is super functional and looks good. I would recommend any organization get it especially during these Covid times.

-Tom

title: Great for business use, horrible for home use
text:
I used teams daily for work the features are great and the app works well. Switching over to personal use for the 365 family edition and it’s missing everything that makes it great, no team set ups. You get Projects, with limited teams like fashion. However it’s really buggy. Trying to create a simple tasks in the project and when you add a checklist to it with more than three items the app crashes.

There is no shared files for these Projects either. All the organization I would use for family things seem to be missing.

title: It’s great when it works...
text:
I don’t know what happened but ever since the beginning of February, this app has been having a lot of trouble. Examples are like not logging in even after you enter your password, app not loading, and even crashing. I ended up deleting and reinstalling the app and that did not do anything.

My experience might be on the extreme side but it’s extremely frustrating when I know I’m unable to answer Teams calls or attend meetings with my phone. I end up using the PC version of Teams and even then, it’s sometimes troubling to even use it due to some of the persistent trouble like not being able to login!

title: Pretty good, but could be cooler
text: I like this for quick, convenient chatting, but sometimes file sharing is complicated and tricky, and it would be awesome if I didn’t have to pop out the window to get the attach link. Took me forever to figure out I could drag and drop files, some instruction or little semi opaque wording that’s says, drag and drop files to send here, or something would have been great! Overall though, I like that this doesn’t become as distracting as slack, but still effectively communicates with the team well!

title: Need option to call in to meetings
text:
Overall, I like Teams, but the meetings functionality needs to allow an option to call in for meetings. Currently, can only connect by the app or using audio/microphone on computer. This makes for terrible meeting experience: 
users who use computer audio alone, so sound distant
others use app to speak, and computer for visual, but don’t turn off computer speakers, causing feedback. 
And some of our contractors can’t connect audio at all as app only allows single acct.
Having dial-in option would solve most audio issues.

title: Could really use some improvements
text: It’s a good app sure, but it like it was only made for mobile users. When using it on PC it basically hates not being the center of attention. It will lag your computer if you have even just one window other than it opened. I would write a review on my computer but everything is laggy and it won’t even let me type in 2 characters without almost freezing for a good minute or two. The PowerPoint feature is good and that’s really the only redeeming quality about it. Other then that, I don’t like it, and would definitely use a different app to do my work and meet with peers

title: Best modern collaboration app
text: This is hands down the best modern collaboration app for anyone.  It brings together all the best things of Microsoft 365 and Office 365 into a single client.  What's more is you can easily build custom tab apps that integrate with it.  Teams is the center of our modern collaboration strategy at work and will help to drive our digital Transformation.  Microsoft watched and learned from all the early offerings and knocked it out of the park.  If you're using Slack or Hipchat today you owe it to yourself to give Teams a honest evaluation.

title: Getting better
text:
I have just started using teams 2 weeks ago. I like all of the integrations and ways to communicate. There is the beginnings of a robust tool. You really need to spend sometime with it before you have a large group on it.  There is so many ways to communicate, you need to understand who and how works together. Because it is not for everyone and there needs to be some ground rules and a culture on how and where you chat, share, todo, delegate, meet and all the apps. And I am sure I will have more to discover.  It seams to integrate with my cell phone very well. 

What I would like to see:
Spell suggestions for those of us who can’t. 

I am currently a guest on two other teams, and when I have one of those current, I can’t answer a call or even here it to switch to answer. 

It would be nice to be able to shut it off at some point on your phone.

title: Delivery Fails
text:
Concept of teams is great but the delivery fails. It has so many issues and it depends on what devices are being used as it’s compatible with some more than others. Microsoft stream makes me pull my hair out. Hyperlinks to videos does not click at one button. I click 10-20 times, and all it does is highlight. I click around the hyperlink, in the hyperlink, around the message box, and after a minute of spastic clicking, it finally opens in a window in which theatre mode is not theatre mode. It cuts off (this is across different types of devices and whether it’s web or app based). 

Unfortunately I have to use teams. Had I not, Microsoft would have to pay me to use this app.

title: The cure for the Mobile User who is constantly on the go
text: Are you constantly on the go and rarely in front of your computer? Well then, the teams mobile app is for you. It includes many of the features as the desktop version including chat, teams news feed, and even video conferencing without even needing to log into an actual computer. Works great with an iPhone and an iPad.

title: Message issues
text: I want to love this service. Search function for texts is great, but what kills it is new texts don’t show up the majority of the time. I will get a notification but the text isn’t there. I have to completely hard close the app and start it again for the message to then appear. This isn’t just me, but is the same for the two other people on my team. It makes it so easy to miss new messages and we are seriously considering just using iMessage though would miss the search function. It’s better than missing critical messages though!!

title: Overall decent, with some limitations
text:
I won’t bother getting into all my nitpicks, but the most serious drawback, especially for a messenger (where it’s sole job is to provide instant communication!) is that it fails to provide instant updates of user statuses and, most damming, of new messages!

Often I will have Teams up on my phone and computer and it will give me completely different information about what threads have been updated and whether a user is online or not, only to update when I interact with the thread/user.

title: Great App but Needs Apple Watch Integration
text: Love using Teams at work. The improvements that have been made, especially in the last 6 months or so, really improve the user experience (and it was good to begin with). My organization uses it constantly now that we’re all working from home. It’s been invaluable for collaboration and communication. The one thing that is at the top of my list to add is Apple Watch integration with a compilation to easily chat and get notifications.

title: Microsoft Doesn’t Care About Teams
text: The mobile Teams app comes packaged with a plethora of bugs and issues, it’s genuinely difficult to decide where to begin. First off, notifications. The system is completely broken. During my shift hours, I will receive non-stop notifications despite being listed as “do not disturb” and having channels muted. Second, phone calls. This system isn’t worth bothering with on mobile. The quality is atrocious and the transferring system doesn’t work at all. In a more broad lens, Teams as a whole suffers from constant outages. Truly, I would never choose to use this service if my employer didn’t require it.

title: Spam Notified by unknown teams on personal emails
text: I am not a user of Teams app and didn’t even have the app installed till today. The reason I had to install the app is just to find out how to remove my name from the team group I didn’t accept invite and still get multiple notifications a day on my personal email from the group? Can’t we have a basic authentication- out of band e.g to ensure that my personal email is not misused by some random person using it on Teams. I looked into the invite and have to send a email to a email in that invite to remove me. How do i get myself unsubscribed from what I didn’t subscribe to begin with. Does it mean anyone can use someone else email address to register?

title: Overall very useful
text: I like all the features on the app version of Teams. The reason I’m not giving five stars is that the Planner Kanban view needs usability improvements. The task cards are too sensitive - it needs to improve distinguishing between scroll gesture and moving task gesture. More than once I ended up moving tasks around when I wanted to simply scroll the screen. Hopefully this will be improved in a future release.

title: Great slack alternative!
text: I finally understood the challenge of trying to get special permission from IT to get Slack installed for my team...and then realized that MSTEAMS is included as a part of our Office 365 package! It seamlessly connects to our outlook directory and different sub-teams can be easily created by creating new DLs in outlook. View/Edit/share native office files in the app itself, setup impromptu meetings (with video) ...Share screens ... great platform overall. Especially if your IT has already invested in Microsoft products.

title: Best Tool for Mass Team Communications and Collaberation
text: I’ve used several apps looking for an easy way to communicate with several people across a wide geographical area with varying success. However, Teams has met all of my needs and then some. It streamlines the ability to pass down guidance and updates to keep my officers across the state informed in real time without having to make 30-40 individual calls.

title: No Notifications
text:
Haven’t been able to get any notifications to display when the app is not in the foreground. Background app refresh settings are proper as well as Notifications at a system and app level. 

Otherwise, Teams is great on OS X and Windows 10!

Update: The problem with the notifications resolved itself. Everyone in our tenant started receiving notifications at the exact same moment without any change on our end. Teams is now fully functional and a great help to our ..... team.

title: Please make transferring
text: Overall, great app. The one thing that I can’t stand, however, is transfers. It takes 30 seconds, and way too many touches to transfer a call. We are an organization of nine people. I shouldn’t have to answer a call, then mute the call, then click to go to the teams app, then click to transfer, then search for a person…it is just too much. I answer the call in the teams app, why am I not in the teams app already?  Can we be able to assign extensions to make it easier?  Something…

title: No Sound
text: The app works well with the exception that the sound is muted if played through my IPhone speaker. Nothing is wrong with my speaker as I can play sound from ALL other apps. I tried clearing the cache, data, history, and any other technical term one would through out there; I tried uninstalling and reinstalling; Even thought I allow access to my microphone, I still do not get sound unless played through a connected Bluetooth device which gets annoying. The microphone is a huge factor when the primary purpose of my usage is for organizational meetings

title: Please update delete chat.
text: Great team chat app in a work place. but one thing I don't like is because I can only hide chat, not delete chat.  It is quite inconvenient when at work, there are several reasons and my colleague and I will sometimes use each other's accounts.  And so if they accidentally click on someone's messages that I hide, they just need to unhide to see all my old messages.  I hope the app can upgrade the chat delete function.

title: Latest update full of bugs.
text:
Hey! I don’t normally leave reviews but when functionality decreases with an update things are pretty bad. Talk to text, a key feature that comes in handy as a parent of a toddler, simply doesn’t work anymore. It does record and transcribe, but hitting send simply causes the text to disappear instead of being sent. 

On top of that, whenever someone messages, there’s now a very high chance that the chat will appear completely blank, and won’t update even if I enter something into it.
